main event: On July 24, 1955, in Akron, Ohio, a civilian and military source reported a sighting of a round, light silvery object, the size of the head of a pin at arm's length, hovering and making no air sound, heading southwest at an altitude of about 15,000 feet.
interesting points: The object was described as round, light silvery, and the size of the head of a pin at arm's length.
It was seen heading southwest at an altitude of about 15,000 feet and made no air sound.
The observation lasted 5-10 minutes and involved only one object.
The reporting officer and the observers suggested that the object could have been a balloon, aircraft, astronomical object, or a reflection of the sun off an aircraft during dusk.
sighted object: One round, light silvery object, the size of the head of a pin at arm's length
